content.question: Which of the following equations represents a reaction with a negative <math alttext="delta S naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="2 N O, gas, plus O 2 gas, react to produce 2 N O 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><mtext>O</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>→</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 K C l O 3, solid, reacts to produce 2 K C l, solid, plus 3 O 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>l</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>→</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>l</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="P C l 5, gas, reacts to produce P C l 3, gas, plus C l 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P</mtext><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>l</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>→</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>P</mtext><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>l</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>l</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="C 3 H 8, gas, plus 5 O 2, gas, react to produce 3 C O 2, gas, plus 4 H 2 O, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 N O, gas, plus O 2 gas, react to produce 2 N O 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><mtext>O</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>→</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 4.A: Predict and/or explain chemical properties or phenomena (e.g., of atoms or molecules) using given chemical theories, models, and representations.
